org.deeplearning4j.clustering.lsh

Class RandomProjectionLSH

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.deeplearning4j.clustering.lsh.RandomProjectionLSH
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    LSH

    public class RandomProjectionLSH
extends java.lang.Object
implements LSH
    This class implements Entropy LSH for the cosine distance, in order to preserve memory for large datasets. Entropy SLH is the LSH scheme of _Entropy based nearest neighbor search in high dimensions_ R Panigrahy - SIAM 2006 https://arxiv.org/pdf/cs/0510019.pdf To read more about LSH, in particular for the Cosine distance, see chapter 3 of : _Mining Massive Datasets_, Anand Rajaraman and Jeffrey Ullman http://www.mmds.org/ The original development of LSH for the cosine distance is from Similarity estimation techniques from rounding algorithms MS Charikar - STOCS, 2002 Note for high-precision or distributed settings, you should not use this and rather extend this to layered LSH ( https://arxiv.org/abs/1210.7057 )

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RandomProjectionLSH(int hashLength, int numTables, int inDimension, double radius) 
      RandomProjectionLSH(int hashLength, int numTables, int inDimension, double radius, Random rng)
      Creates a locality-sensitive hashing index for the cosine distance, a (d1, d2, (180 − d1)/180,(180 − d2)/180)-sensitive hash family before amplification

      • RandomProjectionLSH

        public RandomProjectionLSH(int hashLength,
                           int numTables,

      • RandomProjectionLSH

        public RandomProjectionLSH(int hashLength,
                           int numTables,
                           int inDimension,
                           double radius,
                           Random rng)
        Creates a locality-sensitive hashing index for the cosine distance, a (d1, d2, (180 − d1)/180,(180 − d2)/180)-sensitive hash family before amplification
        Parameters:
        hashLength - the length of the compared hash in an AND construction,
        numTables - the entropy-equivalent of a nb of hash tables in an OR construction, implemented here with the multiple probes of Panigraphi (op. cit).
        inDimension - the dimendionality of the points being indexed
        radius - the radius of points to generate probes for. Instead of using multiple physical hash tables in an OR construction
        rng - a Random object to draw samples from

      • getDistanceMeasure

        public java.lang.String getDistanceMeasure()
        Description copied from interface: LSH
        Returns an instance of the distance measure associated to the LSH family of this implementation. Beware, hashing families and their amplification constructs are distance-specific.
        Specified by:
        getDistanceMeasure in interface LSH

      • entropy

        public INDArray entropy(INDArray data)
        This picks uniformaly distributed random points on the unit of a sphere using the method of: An efficient method for generating uniformly distributed points on the surface of an n-dimensional sphere JS Hicks, RF Wheeling - Communications of the ACM, 1959
        Parameters:
        data - a query to generate multiple probes for
        Returns:
        `numTables`
